website_summaries.verdict: It won't work for every man, but for those who want a very compact wallet and like modern gadgets, it's an affordable and unique option.
pros: A nice alternative to traditional leather wallets, thanks to the aluminum workmanship that makes it fit effortlessly in front pockets
Features a secure money clip, space for up to 20 cards, and RFID blocking
Some owners rave about using it for business cards
cons: Compared to traditional wallets, it takes a bit of time to get use to and isn't for everyone
The trade-off of the slim design is that it isn't easy to access all the cards

customer_reviews.title: cool idea. definitely saves space
customer_reviews.text: cool idea. definitely saves space. Gets super annoying and its a lot easier to not find your cards than it is. I don't even know if it truly is an effective RFID blocker. it was an impulse buy looking for a slimmer way to declutter my pockets. for that purpose it did work well. however getting cards in an out and finding the right card without holding up the line of our ever so patient society these days proves to be a challenge. Switched back to a classic leather wallet eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jr

customer_reviews.title: Simple design that works
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 3 weeks now. I carry 6 "cards" (including my drivers license). They fit well, are very secure, and are comfortable to carry in the front pocket. I tuck any cash in the band and this works well too. As others have stated removing a card can prove less than easy at first but what I found is after a few attempts you get the hang of it. Tip: keep your most used cards on top and bottom as cards in those positions are the easiest to get to quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this wallet in the store and decided to take a chance. When I opened the box, I was a bit disappointed. The band that secures the wallet is rubber and after fitting the wallet with cards, it was challenging to easily remove cards without taking the wallet apart. The rubber band loosely worked as a money clip but it wasn't efficient or secure. I ended up just tossing it out and getting a different wallet. I hope it works for you, but it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, not amazing, not terrible.
customer_reviews.text: It works how you imagine. Pretty easy getting stuff in and out. I have a good amount of cards and card-size tools, it all works fine in this. But the metal edges can be sharp, it broke the first rubber band after a couple days by rubbing or bumping in my pocket. I wanted to see how I'd like this style of wallet, i think for a minimalist it's good. But if you like to carry more, or you do hard labor, its not really ideal. And using it with cash is more difficult than a normal wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Biggs

customer_reviews.title: allows you to easily gauge how much "stuff" you have with you
customer_reviews.text: I use this wallet everyday for a few months now and I can't go back to either the leather wallets, jimi wallets, aluminum wallets you find in grocery store checkouts, butterfly wallets, or anything else. It's silicone and metal - so it doesn't fray or look worn no matter what you put it through. The materials are non-absorbent, so it doesn't pick up sweat while it's in your pocket, allows you to easily gauge how much "stuff" you have with you. Most importantly, it takes what would be a very fat stack of cards in a traditional wallet and makes it thin and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha N. Ferrer Perez

customer_reviews.title: Tight fitting band makes access somewhat difficult
customer_reviews.text: The one good feature of this card holder is that it is not much larger than a credit card. Unfortunately, it makes getting to your cards awkward and somewhat difficult. To get to a card, you have to remove the band that holds everything together, releasing all your cards, which you then have to shuffle through to get the one you want. This would not be so bad except for the fact that the band is very tight and hard to remove and to reinstall. The holder comes with two bands, one of which is supposedly somewhat larger than the other, but I could not tell any difference between them.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Williams

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good in Concept, Terrible in Use
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this style wallet a try after being a standard leather wallet guy. A high quality leather wallet will last many many years, and keeps everything easily accessible. First issue with this wallet is it does not actually block RFID signal. Not even a little bit. Second issue, it's very hard to get a specific card out, unless it's on the outside. Finally, the strap broke after less than 1 month of use with 8 cards inside. It's cheap, but I would still expect a bit better life out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Slim, pretty, durable.
customer_reviews.text: This wallet is a butt saver. I previously had the regular old bill fold style wallet and with the number of cards I am required to carry around it was really leaving a wallet shaped indent in my back side. This, however, is a really good alternative to that. Nice and thin, looks great and is pretty easy to use. I still need to figure out a better way to get the cards out of the middle ha! That's my only issue with it, getting cards out of the middle of the stack.
customer_reviews.author: T.J

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: This is okay. It's just too pieces of flat metal with a big rubber band. I do have a lot of different cards (credit, debit, ID, rewards cards, company cards etc). And it fits everything well. The down side is that it's still difficult to get cards out. Everything sure seem pretty secure and it is a little thinner than my previous wallet. I'll use it for a while, but I'll probably end up replacing it at some point to easily access my cards.
customer_reviews.author: Dex

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I don't have to carry a lot of stuff. It is great I keep my drivers license in it and money. I don't like to carry credit cards so this does the job great. I did need to put cards in it and it did it's job but I didn't like that it completely blocked the rfid so my cards with the chip in stayed behind. If you like a small wallet with a small band to hold it together it works great. It is barely noticeable which is a good thing and a bad thing because you may check it is there more often than a standard bi fold wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Near perfection. A little difficult for use with cash.
customer_reviews.text: Near perfection. I had a similar style wallet for a while, but the rubber band wore out and almost broke. I love the style so much (same size as my cards, no need to be any larger), so I got the same style, different brand. The metal plates are thick and sturdy, moreso than the previous wallet I had. Only downside is that since there are notches in the metal plates, such that the rubber band sits nearly flush with the metal, it's difficult to use the rubber band as a "money clip." I have to work a bit to get my finger under the rubber band, in order to slide a few bills in there. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Its a rubber band around a bunch of cards.
customer_reviews.text: Lets be honest. What this is, essentially is, Its a rubber band around a bunch of cards. They add a couple of RF blocking cards on either side, and the rubber b and is very sturdy. so it looks nice. But I have too many cards for this, so it just didn't work out for me. But it is well made and looks nice. and you get exactly what you see. its just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: QBeing

customer_reviews.title: Best minimalist wallet I've found yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet. Most recently, I was using the Nomad wallet; however, the Nomad feels cheap and has a small capacity. The Roco wallet both feels and looks great. While the Nomad, when presented, felt childish, the Roco feels professional and modern. It also can hold many cards if you need them. I usually keep about 12-15 cards maximum, but the wallet comes with two rubber bands - one for lesser capacity, and another for higher capacity. Overall, the Roco wallet feels solid and looks great. It has quickly become my daily driver as a wallet, and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer T.

customer_reviews.title: first wallet that isnt made of leather
customer_reviews.text: This wallet is a little different. it looks different. and can hold a lot of cards with out having the trouble of not being able to fold shut, because it doesn't fold like a normal old school wallet. The big issue here is that it wears out your outside cards. some of the cards I own now have trouble being read on the chip readers, its not a big deal since re inserting the chips into the readers allows them to be read, but you can see more where on the cards when they sit in this wallet
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Arrieta

customer_reviews.title: It is very compact
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this product I wasn’t sure what to expect, it comes with two bands depending on how many cards you will be holding one is slightly larger if you have more cards, I love the compact size really minimizes the junk that I carry, I have the smaller band on with the maximum amount of cards sometimes it’s a little hard to get the cards out but I expect The river band that goes around the pieces of aluminum will loosen up over time I love the aluminum finish and the anodizing that’s on it I got the black one is very nice for the price you can’t beat it I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Karl Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this out as I dislike have a wallet in my back pocket and it is amazing. You have two different bands to choose from based on hope many cards you carry. I alsohave found that folded cash on the outside stays put really well because of the rubber band. The only thing I would say is that if you are getting this to carry business cards the metal is not looking enough and the outside cards will moist likely start to get bent and damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Augustus

customer_reviews.title: For the boss that has everything, this was a perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: My boss has everything, so was very tough to find a gift for him. He talked about minimalist wallet and I came across this. I bought my self a different name brand that was a lot more expensive and is already falling apart. I think I will be picking up one of these myself if my replacement doesn't work out. He loved how simple it was to pop out the cards and hold his money in place. He said he hasn't carried a wallet in years. He has been using a cell phone case that holds 3 cards. Let's see if this investment pays off when it's raise time :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevlar

customer_reviews.title: A nice minimalist wallet.
customer_reviews.text: If you're not a fan of your cards breaking or morphing from traditional wallets, then this is the wallet for you. This wallet comes with two bands; a large band and small band. Initially, I was skeptical about whether the band's elasticity would wear down or not, but after about a year of continuous use the band is still strong. The metal frame and design protects my cards, while allowing for easy access to my cards. One flaw is that it does not hold cash very well. So, if you like bills, then you may want to get a more traditional wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I really like it
customer_reviews.text: Great wallet, I wish the notches were deeper as I end up pulling the cards out a bit further almost every time anyway. I bought it for the silicone strap because I thought that was better than elastic. I wish there were a third strap that was a big bigger than the two provided. These two work for me, but I have a friend who carries a TON of cards, and I'd like to get him one, but there's no point as it stands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool but silly
customer_reviews.text: Great looking... but a little silly... standing in line one must either take a chance on scraping a card surface getting it out or removing the rubber band to make all the cards loose... then trying to juggle the cards back in a stack and fumbling the band back in place... thought it would fan open... nope it’s just a cool little tight package with a rubber band to hold everything together... saved about 1/16th of an inch
customer_reviews.author: Shirley M. Baff

customer_reviews.title: Sleek product, would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Really a great little wallet. Its two pieces of metal with a silicone/rubber band thing for the middle. The packaging was very nice and it includes a band for smaller and one that accommodates more cards. The smaller band holds three cards very snugly and I don't feel like there is any way a card would slip out. The best part of this wallet though in my opinion is that there is no part that feels like it would wear down over time, and nothing that snags when pulling it in and out of my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Just got my wallet and (so far) it's been great! I switched to a front pocket wallet a while ago with a cheap metal card clip from Walmart. Then moved on to a HellBent Holsters Combat Wallet which I still love, but I'm a gear junkie so I thought I'd give this a try. Seems well made and the RFID blocking on both sides is nice so you don't have to be cognizant of which way you put it in your pocket for it to be effective. I'll update if my opinion changes, but as of now...we'll worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: Ripped band, haven't been able to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Seller states can't purchase replacement bands. Wallet lasted less than 3 months. Standard band ripped less than 2 months of use. have sent multiple emails to seller to get a replacement and haven't had any return correspondence. Large band is too loose for the few cards I carry.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got a extra strap
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to replace my traditional wallet and saw this card holder. Works great, holds a lot of cars and if about half the thickness of my regular wallet. Only issue I have happened today when the original strap that holds everything together failed. I was a little surprised since I've only had it about 6 months. Luckily it comes with a replacement strap but my concern is what do I do when/if the replacement strap fails? Luckily is inexpensive enough to be replaced without hurting your pocket, but the ability to purchase additional straps is keeping me from giving it 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Staciano

customer_reviews.title: A good idea....in theory
customer_reviews.text: The product comes w/ two rubber bands, the larger of which is too large for the handful of cards, license, and permits that I need to carry. The smaller band does a better job holding the contents in place, but getting a particular card or your license out of the device is much harder than is convenient, and I've already abandoned using it for a better designed item.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool and fits easily in the pocket. The product is basically 2 planks of machined aluminum, held together by a rubber band. You keep your cards between the planks and the cash is to be folded and placed under the rubber band, on the outside of the planks. So far, it's been very easy to use and looks kind of cool. Once loaded, the cards slip in between the planks pretty easily. Still getting used to slipping cash under the rubber band. Right now the cash folding process takes a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Khan

customer_reviews.title: Travel wallet
customer_reviews.text: It's an interesting item. I carry to much cc, ffmc, hotel group cards. So for me to pull the band off and all my cards fall to the floor. If it's 2-3-4 cards this is great. Interesting design and concept. Very rugged and made of good quality it's just not for me. What I did was use it for other cards and it's in my computer bag
customer_reviews.author: jitou812

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice doesnt block RFID
customer_reviews.text: My friend has a a Ridge, we used our ID card to scan and see if the building scanner would work. It did not on his Ridge on the ROCO is worked and did not block the scanner. Logic tells you it is NOT blocking RFID. I want a full refund...
customer_reviews.author: RRE

customer_reviews.title: Small and it works.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my money clip wallet which really wasn't big, but I wanted smaller. This does the trick. I have 8 cards in it at all times and a few cash bills under the rubber-band. With apple pay and me really only using 1 physical credit card 98% of the time, this servers the purpose well. Would definitely purchase again and can't see myself every not using this style "wallet" again.
customer_reviews.author: Riding Dirty

customer_reviews.title: Still great after one year
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas in 2017. I've carried anywhere from 10 to 18 cards at a time. It took a little time getting used to this type of wallet, but now I'll never go back to a traditional wallet. The strap is silicone and has maintained its elasticity well. I find it very easy to remove and insert cards. I keep the frequency used card on the outside which makes it quick and easy. I keep my car keys in the same pocket, so the black anodized coating has started to wear off around the edges, but that's my only complaint. If this ever wears out, I would not hesitate to buy another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: On the fence
customer_reviews.text: This is my sole wallet. I switch from a bulky leather trifold. This forces me to be minimalistic, which was the reason I bought it. I've got about 5-10 cards at any time in it. The only thing I absolutely hate about it is carrying cash. I don't even use cash, but in rare instances, but when you need it, you need it. Any more than three bills and it'll slide around and fall out if you're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super Slick and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a slim RFID blocking travel wallet, this is a good choice... there are more expensive versions, but this does the job very well, at a fraction of the price. For me personally, it's a little too difficult to access the items inside the wallet for everyday use, but I use a debit card far more often than cash. If you use cash more often, this could be a trick, everyday option to the traditional wallet...
customer_reviews.author: Dad the Maker

customer_reviews.title: Great, resistant and ultra thin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wallet for my husband. He doesn’t like traditional wallets because they are to big and bulky and he normally just carries around his credit card and drivers license (the bare minimum). This is a great wallet since it’s so thin and it comes with 2 different sizes of the silicone bands to fit a few cards or a whole lot with the bigger one. It is a bit tricky at the beginning to get used to taking the card out but after a few daya you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: 2 Metals and a Rubber Band
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting to open the box and see 2 metal plates and a rubber band. The provided images are slightly misleading. However, that being said, I put my ~10 cards in it and to my surprise I've been really digging this case. Very minimalistic, slim, and easy to pull out any card I want. I don't carry cash or coins with this, but I don't really come across situations where I need them on a normal basis. If you find this on deal of the day or sale period around $10 or less, & you're itching for a minimalist wallet then I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: NikBlaze

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it does
customer_reviews.text: As an upgrade over a hair tie for a wallet, this is pretty cool. It's really thin and the rubber band part stays on well...also doesn't slip out of your pocket at all. The metal part looks nice and is holding up well after two months. The band gets covered in lint/dust which doesn't bother me or really make it look bad. But it doesn't stay as clean looking as when you first use it. The only other issue is that it's pretty hard to get cards out that aren't on the top or bottom of the stack. Not impossible but just difficult and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great small wallet
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over 2 years and the band I was using finally gave away. Using the other band and hope it holds up or maybe ROCCO can send me more bands for use. Mine holds 20+cards and money just fine. Way better than the leather wallet I had in my back pocket, this one fits in front pocket perfectly. Just need more BANDS...
customer_reviews.author: BigSky109

customer_reviews.title: A tricked out money clip
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting, I thought it was a slim wallet from the main picture. Once you recieve it or look closey at the other pictures, you will realize it is just a tricked out money clip. That being said the rubber band contraption holds everything nicely. However, I should have just bought a rubber band. The results would be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jes Se

customer_reviews.title: It's great to throw in a front pocket and is almost ...
customer_reviews.text: Been carrying this for a few months. I am loving this wallet. I have about 9-10 cards in it usually, with some cash strapped to the outside. It's great to throw in a front pocket and is almost un-noticed in dress/suit pants. Plus its a great size to slip down in the waistband of gym shorts with no pockets and the rubber strap keeps it from sliding out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: but the convenience is too great! Going from a huge card packed wallet to ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was only going to use this on rare occasions, but it's turning into my main 'wallet'. I still get a little worried I'll scrape off the numbers of my credit card, or leave scratch marks on the front of my driver's license, but the convenience is too great! Going from a huge card packed wallet to the essential 3-4 cards is a relieve. It fits very comfortable in your front pocket, and you can even clip money under the band (if you still carry cash).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wallet
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of my old wallet in my front pocket and searched for an affordable minimalist front pocket wallet. This guy has been wonderful. I carry my drivers license, state ID, Nexus card, AAA card, and eight credit cards and it's still thinner than my old tri-fold. I was recently at a hotel with RFID room keys and the wallet did a fantastic job of blocking the signal no matter where I put it. Also tested with the RFID system on the 3D printers at work and it blocked that. I'm very happy with this and recommend it. Oh, the rubber straps do not have the ROCO branding on them..
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Better than a plain rubberband around my cards and drivers ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than a plain rubberband around my cards and drivers license. Keeps everything nice and neat and slim. It's s bit difficult to get the cards out though. The cut-out is in the middle and it should be on the ends so you can use your thumb. But I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I saw it was on sale and at first I wasn't sure I liked it. It is three separate pieces and it seemed really odd. I wanted to give it a try and I'm actually really glad I did. It comes with two of the bands, different sizes, and the two metal face plates. It really cut down on the clutter of a standard wallet. I sometimes forget what pocket I put it in because it's slim and lightweight. I currently am carrying my driver's license, a second ID, and three credit cards as well as some cash and it's perfect. I'm not going back to a billfold ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Double T

customer_reviews.title: RFID fail
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying this wallet around for about three months. After the initial functionality learning curve, I became accustomed to how to operate it and operate it quickly. The low profile was amenable to back pocket, front pocket, and jacket pocket usage. Recently, I was able to do some extensive testing of the advertised RFID blockage, and the wallet failed miserably. Not only did it allow free read of my building access card, but external readers had no issues picking up card information from inside the wallet either. Wonderful carbon footprint and design. Absolutely dismal RFID protection, if any.
customer_reviews.author: paakira

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t lose it !!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. It’s pretty sturdy. None of my cards or even business cards have fallen out. The only thing is that freaking lose it all the time!! Lol that’s my fault though. I’m planning to buy a chip so I can track it. It would be cool if they added a feature like that. Feels legit and holds enough. I don’t carry 100 cards and receipts. Just my basic 2 debt cards, license and business cards. Fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: SimpleWord

customer_reviews.title: Love it - really good value
customer_reviews.text: Actually worked out great, even though initially I didn't understand how to "load" cards into this. It gets 4 stars, because I personally haven't tested the RFID protecting capability - I'm skeptical, and because of one design flaw. They should really beveled the end pieces on both sides, so as to make it easier to put a card into it (the product photos don't reveal a flat non-beveled inside edge), and this makes putting cards in a little challenging. I've been using it for a couple of months now, and I'm very happy. Really slimmed down my wallet, and still is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Sacha Narinx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for women as well as men!
customer_reviews.text: I have about 18 cards which this product holds securely with the larger band. I used the smaller one for awhile, but it was too tight and removal of one card was difficult. I was always forgetting my purse, but this product fits right in my front pocket and is always with me. Removing a card is more difficult than retrieving one from a traditional wallet, but the size, convenience, and the safety far outweigh that slight difference. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Stylish card wallet
customer_reviews.text: I love this for the few cards I need to carry. I carry only 3 or 4 cards on a regular basis. This is perfect for that. The slightly larger band that came with mine allows for a few folded bills to be tucked on one side. I have no idea if it provides RFID protection or not, but it's not a particular issue where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle of replacing your cards when they get too scratched.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wallet for my boyfriend and he liked it alright, but both bands (even the more loose one) were too tight and wore away at the backing of his cards so that he had trouble swiping and inevitably had to get another card. It also doesn't interact well with chips which it will also scrape and you will need to replace. Overall, it's attractive at first, but not worth having to replace your cards every few months because of the wear on the metal against your drivers license laminate or card strip.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Perry

customer_reviews.title: Gave It A Try, Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had slim wallets in the past, so I knew what to expect. I have this wallet a shot for about two weeks. I like how my cards/cash were in between the two pieces of metal - as opposed to my other wallet exposing them - but I found it rather difficult to get cards/cash in and out of the wallet. I did not stuff the wallet full of cards either. I had about five, maybe six. Plus, I wish ROCO would supply a choice of color for the bands as opposed to just all black. Decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: TheeCW

customer_reviews.title: Cool Looking but Not Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I purchased this for a business car holder and it works great for that but if used for a wallet it would be difficult to use regularly. It is literally (2) pieces of aluminum and a rubber band so you must remove the band to get it loaded and then its hard to get to middle of the stack of cards.
customer_reviews.author: dsddcd

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this wallet for about 3 months now. It took some time to get used to, because I was used to having a flip wallet, but this has helped me become even more of a minimalist, I get compliments on it, fits right in my front pocket and I never have to worry about someone trying to steal my information again. Comes with two bands if you need to put more than necessary in the wallet. Holds cash on the outside really well!!
customer_reviews.author: Twitch

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, great product
customer_reviews.text: Quality all the way. The machining is excellent and the feel is confident. It comes with 2 bands, one for a smaller group of cards and a larger one if you have a bigger load to carry. Either way, it holds securely and access to my cards is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this wallet it holds my cash firmly as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this wallet it holds my cash firmly as well as my cards and is much easier to sit on then a normal wallet. I also found a little trick to make it easier to take the cards out. If you push them all to one side you can then pinch the wallet and they will expand almost like a fan making them easy to look through and find the one you want
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: GOOD. BUT BETTER ARE THERE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this approximately a year ago and it still holds up until now, but I believe that is due to the very light use of which it is used. As can be seen in image two (2), there is rip on the rubber band that's is to hold the two plates together to keep your cards together. I believe there are better options out there which will ensure the safety of your cards by preventing them from falling out if the rubber band were to rip, but for what it's worth they do there job; however, I would not recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: O.R

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wallet
customer_reviews.text: Nice Wallet and holds my cards just fine. I'm not too impressed with the second rubber strap that was sent with the wallet, I'ts supposed to be for carrying more cards in the wallet but it's not the same material as the Roco strap that has its name imprinted in the rubber. Looks like a cheaper made material than the other. Will keep you updated on how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: B.J.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my boyfriend. He had one previously that lasted several years. After the elastic started to wear we were sure it would break soon. It still hasn’t but tired of playing with fire we replaced it anyways. The quality is still amazing and hopefully this one will last for just as long as the first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and Stylish. Handles a few bills OK.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how much I like this after having a large wallet for years. It's small, it's light, and it has my ID, a few cards, and even sticking in some cash doesn't feel like the stack is compromised or anything will fall out. They did include 2 different bands, though I have never used the second one. I don't think I'm going back to a regular wallet after this since I won't carry enough cash to make it difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's different
customer_reviews.text: The anodizing makes it look like it has a grain to it, sort of like wood. It adds character to the slabs of CNC-cut aluminum. Don't know how long the rubber bands will last, but I'm sure that I can find something to replace them should they fail. Did not test RFID shielding ability yet. One caution is to not put it in the same pocket as a smartphone, or screen scratching may be the result.....
customer_reviews.author: A. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist sleek wallet with one issue that can't be avoided.
customer_reviews.text: Minimalist wallet with a great look, compact, and lightweight. I wanted to love this wallet, but I have stopped using it for one clear unavoidable issue. Within a month of using each band, both developed splits that will only get worse with more use to the point where everything will just fall apart. I did contact the seller and there are no replacements available for purchase. I bumped it up one star because of the sleek look and the possibility in the future I will purchase replacement bands elsewhere, but overall it didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: rdiamond

customer_reviews.title: If you think you'll like it you probably will. Wouldn't reccomend as a daily-carry.
customer_reviews.text: It's basically the equivalent of a money-clip but for cards, definitely a little too minimalist to replace my wallet. However, it is well built and it came with an extra band. By well built I mean that they even beveled the inside so that the cards slide in easily. Currently I have this holding just one very important card so that it's not just loose in my desk. Its good for that, makes it easy to find, adds some weight to it. And I'm using the extra band to hold a giant stack of expired and useless cards. I am definitely getting my money's worth, it's just not what I wanted it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist wallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great minimalist wallet, if you're like me and rarely have cash (though this does hold cash well!) and only carry 6-9 cards with you than you will like this wallet. I've been using it for a couple of months now and love it. I can easily fit it in my front pocket with car keys and the rubber band stops it from moving around. Most of the negative reviews seem to be from buyers who are trying to use too many cards with it - which is exactly the opposite of what this wallet is for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice wallet for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different wallets I've only had this one for a couple days and I'm already loving it very Sleek no sharp edges so it's comfortable in the pocket when you're sitting driving easy to pull cards in and out if you have the right rubber band for the amount of cards you have I use the bigger one I carry about 11 cards up to 14 depending the smaller band says it will hold up to 14 cards but it seemed a little snug the larger band feels perfect
customer_reviews.author: robert husted

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my son for his birthday. After trying it out and being embarrassed when his credit cards and money flew all over the counter at the restaurant, a couple times actually, he decided it wasn't going to work for him! I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda DeWeese

customer_reviews.title: Thank you! This wallet is great.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased to get this front pocket wallet. It is as slim as you like, only depends on how many cards you need in it. Great quality! Just what I was looking for. Update: I have had this wallet for over a year now and I still love it. Band is still as strong as it was the day I got it. This wallet is not for everyone though, so I can understand some of the lower reviews on it, but I did not let those reviews deter me from purchasing this and gave it a test. I love it and will order another in the future. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get cards in and out. I gave up!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to get cards in and out. I tried to get used to this but had several bad experiences when trying to get out one card and they all popped out and fell on the floor in the checkout line (even with the looser band). Also hard trying to out cash in the elastic strap. I finally gave up after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: This is not a normal wallet.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product so far. Took about a week to adjust until it was a normal reaction pulling out the wallet. You forget about the wallet even being in the pocket. Hold the sides slide the cards up then pinch the bottom to create a wedge. Then scroll through your cards like a mini Rolodex.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It looks cool, but when it comes down to it
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool, but when it comes down to it, this wallet doesn't serve the task at hand. It's not easy to remove your credit cards or put them back. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and counting!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this wallet for about two years and I still love it, it’s still great even after being dropped countless times also the rubber band around it still has superb strength and still keeps all my cards and cash packed tightly. I would definitely recommend this wallet for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Toke

customer_reviews.title: Nice and slim!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, simple but it works. I hoped it came with a bigger band so I can use more cards with it. If you have let's say 10 cards this will work fine, now me I have close to 20. They are not all credit cards but member cards, insurance, and so on. But like I said it her then that it's great, nice slim and gets the job done. I will be using this when we go out of town and just take the major cards with me.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and slim but is a pain in the azz ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and slim but is a pain in the azz if you are in a hurry and need to take out a card. You have to remove the rubber band and expose all your cards just to use one. is not practical, just a "good looking" piece. I'm sending it back ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: TTTTT

customer_reviews.title: Truly minimalist, but that's a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Truly minimalist. It's essentially two aluminum plates held together by a fairly thick rubber band, but it has saved so much room for me. My other wallet was bulky and no matter which pocket it was in, it was pretty obvious what it was. With the ROCO Minimalist Aluminum Slim Wallet, I can put it in my back pocket and not get uncomfortable sitting in the car anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: The rubber strap didn't take long to break
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this because it held a good number of cards but he's only had it since January and by March the strap had broken and he was using an actual rubber band. I put in for a return and it was accepted but I have to pay to ship it back and it's not worth it to ship to China. Already bought another wallet. This one isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dray

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet with a small footprint. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this wallet for a while now. It works real well, fits in my front pocket with all my credit cards, and cash with no problems. I’ve had many comments from people I’ve been with that upon seeing it have said, “oh this looks nice,” and when they look at it they really, really like it. As I really really like it. I highly recommend it. It’s great, go buy it. You’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Burchell

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product. Does what it’s supposed to do and there true to it’s advertised information. I’ve owned the product almost two years now and will need to obtain new replacement bands. More my fault than defective product, as I’m certain I accidentally put a small cut in my large band, but that was some time ago and it’s never grown or given way. It’s a just time to get replacements instead of pushing my luck. I did buy several more for other friends and family after buying mine and they have no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice, small sized wallet alternative
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice small solution for carrying around you ID and credit cards, and I like the band for holding cash as opposed to an actual clip, it keeps the width down. So far it seems sturdy and I have now ditched my traditional wallet in favor of this.
customer_reviews.author: James Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Works well for those who carry few cards and no cash.
customer_reviews.text: The wallet works OK. I, unfortunately, do carry about 15 cards with me and this wallet will definitely hold it. I like the metal look and it fits really well in your pocket. The issues I have with it is that (1) if you have to try and search for a card other than the first one on the stack, you pretty much have to pull everything out and leaf through it (2) if you carry cash, the rubber band is hard to deal with. I found that you have to "stuff" the money under the band, leaving it unorganized.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Coburn

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a small wallet; perfect!
customer_reviews.text: There’s nothing to dislike about this product. Now, what I like about this product, it’s $14.95 (I spent approximately $22 in total with shipping & handling). Comes in different colors. It arrived well packaged, and of course, the wallet itself is really small! Compared to the wallets I’ve used before, I can put this one in my front pockets, instead of my back pocket. Luckily, they give you and extra band. So to any of you questioning if you should purchase this wallet, I highly recommend it. Take it from me. You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lopez

customer_reviews.title: At first I didn't like this but after a few days of using it ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn't like this but after a few days of using it it's starting to grow on me. Mad me throw away half the junk in my leather back pocket wallet. Got this because my chiropractor said sitting on your wallet everyday tweaks your back. Makes sense and hasn't really been bothering me
customer_reviews.author: Alex and Kelly LaHote

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Oh I don't remember when i bought it probably 2 years ago but I still am using it and it is still as good as new. the rubber is a bit loose now but if you manage to save the extra rubber it comes with, you will be good for 3-4 years. It's not easy to use or the best wallet, but you get used to it and is really slim even with 11 cards and a couple 20's bill.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Jabbar

customer_reviews.title: Well, to its credit, the item was minimalist ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, to its credit, the item was minimalist, as advertised. But, unfortunately, it is by no means a wallet. Instead, it is 2 separate pieces of metal, which can be held together with one of two thick rubber bands. So, if you need anything from the “wallet,” you have to remove the rubber band. This, of course, risks the possibility of anything within falling out. I am returning this ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B Pearlstein

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dad as he is always losing his money clips and uses these when he has a night out. It works great and looks good. The 2 straps help if he needs to bring more than a couple cards with him. It keeps everything in safer than his usual money clips and is RFID which is nice these days. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie NelsonTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: It was a great solution for the bulky wallet that was wearing holes ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, and he loves it! It was a great solution for the bulky wallet that was wearing holes in the pocket of his jeans. Clearly, he can't take as many cards, receipts, or cash as before, but he has all needs. Currently, he's just using the smaller belt, but could put on the larger belt if he wanted to carry more in the wallet. Great product and great value!
customer_reviews.author: thegirlyonfire

customer_reviews.title: Small and sturdy. What else do you want?
customer_reviews.text: I've used this wallet for a long time. One of the bands it shipped with broke after a year's use, so I put on the other one and have been going strong for another 2 years. It's small. It does block RFID. It's not really meant to hold cash, so I stick mine under the band. A lot smaller than what I was carrying around.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Not for a cash guy, perfect for a card guy
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal, if you don't use much cash (like only 5 bills max) this is perfect. Super small, fits in your front pocket with a very small profile. If you prefer cash (me), and like to carry enough to "get home" no matter what... it squirts out of the wallet all the time. You can't really get it in between the cards and keep it there. But if you're a card guy, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: looks chic. functions well
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of time to get used to getting cards in and out. I find putting the cash in and out of the band a little annoying due to the tension. That's due to the overall design of these types of wallets. The brand and quality itself is great. Looks very modern and simple.
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: So simple, yet so perfect
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple concept, yet so perfect. I got sick and tired of my bulging wallet. Back pain if you keep your wallet in the back pocket. I purchased an RFID wallet before but it was just a glorified business card holder. Had to return it. This ROCO was only 15 bucks, but has me so happy. I've got over 20 cards in this.
customer_reviews.author: Buysalot

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels Good!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to give this one a try... Much better quality than the previous one I had bought for much cheaper price. It was a brand named R**. Previous one could hold 2-6 cards although I’ve noticed if carrying 5-6 cards, and a few bills the cards began to bend somewhat. With the Rocco slim wallet, my cards don’t bend. They stay straight and quality is much better, the plates protect the cards best. So far I’m liking this wallet better. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Armando C

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It take some getting used to not sitting on a large wallet all day, but it is a great improvement. It can occasionally be a bit of a chore to find the right card and get to it if you're in line at a store and in a hurry, but I think it is well worth not having to carry a bulky wallet. Construction is solid and the band holds great. I am even more pleased with this than I imagined I would be when I bought it. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: I just bought a $15 rubber band
customer_reviews.text: Minimalist wallets seem to be all the rage these days, and I wanted one to make things easier. And while, yes, the wallet is adjustable for a decent amount of cards, it basically has a giant rubber band holding two cards tightly together. It's hard to get cards in and out of it, and even harder to use as a money clip (you have to stretch the rubber band somehow to put the money under the band). I got what I paid for, but realistically, I should have paid more for something a bit better. I can barely get my cards in or out due to the rubber grabbing onto every card.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: After a week, very impressed. Extremely thin and works well for front pocket carry. I've gotten at least 3 questions on where I got it. I do expect the rubber band around it will wear out, and a 2nd was provided but for the price and functionality, I'd just buy it again if I cannot find a replacement rubber band after the 2nd wears out.
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, comes with a spare band for different quantity of cards. Cards go in and out without too much effort. I cannot detect my business cards RFID when inside wallet. That being said, they are the only RFID cards I have so I cannot comment on other credit or debit cards having their signal blocked. Great packaging. No issues with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron J.

customer_reviews.title: Best Front Pocket Wallet I Have Had!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I hate bulky wallets and usually just carry my cards and money in my front pockets. This product is strongly built, durable, and provides an easy way to keep your cards together and also put cash in it if you wish. This product is perfect for someone with my preferences of not carrying a wallet around. I would strongly recommend this product to anyone wishing for something simple to carry their cards around.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Robbins II

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, however, not overly functional. Of course being a minimalist wallet you don’t expect it to be a Swiss Army knife, however, it’s VERY difficult to get cards out of it, to the point where it’s largely just a cool thing to look at. Comes with two bands, only one of which is branded. That little tid bit made it seem like a poorly manufactured product. Looks great, pieces of aluminum seem solid, however the bands aren’t right enough to really hold anything on the outside and the lack of stability makes it difficult to retrieve cards, the wallet starts to fall apart when you try to get a card out.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Murphy

customer_reviews.title: love this slim wallet
customer_reviews.text: love this slim wallet. wish i could purchase more of the bands as a replacement (in case mine snaps) to have as a back up. liked it so much i bought one for my brother. Update: still love the wallet. But noticed that some of my card lamination is starting to peel since the covers of the wallet are flush with the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Zapanta Jr

customer_reviews.title: Slim Minimalist Design
customer_reviews.text: I like how slim this is. It's discrete and small enough to wear on the pockets of suit slacks. However, it can take a bit of force to pull the metal clasps apart to pull any card out. So, likely, one will simply have to remove the elastic band, take the card out, and put it back together after one is done. It is easier to put a card into the group without having to remove the elastic band..
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure this would work, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect! At first I was reluctant that it wouldn't hold enough and I wouldn't carry cash as often. Turns out, even the slim band holds everything I need and I was unaware just how infrequently I use cash for anything these days. If I had a complaint: business cards are slightly too long to fit, but traditional wallets often ruined business cards anyway. The RFID protection is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: P. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic card holder
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as gifts and kept a leftover. Fantastically compact (comes with an extra band I haven't needed after repeated use over a year), not the best at keeping wads of cash, but nice to find out it does RFID-blocking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bartholme

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. I wish that it was a little bit looser. I have loss of movement in one of my thumbs and it makes it a bit difficult to get stuff out. However that does mean that it won’t fall out by itself if I drop it. This eliminates the need of a purse or a huge wallet for me. I can just throw it into my pocket and I’m good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: A definite good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty good. I bought another similar wallet that I enjoyed just as much until I lost it which led me to buy this one. What I really enjoy about these types of wallets is that they don't weigh your pants down like my previous trifold leather wallet. If I could make any suggestions I'd say you might want to slap a tile square onto it because its easy to misplace, especially when doing laundry.... >_<
customer_reviews.author: KameSennin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this new wallet! Every traditional wallet I've owned always ends with it stretching out and becomes to thick and uncomfortable, even when I carry it in my front pocket. This one can't do that and is even smaller than any traditional wallet. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

product_meta.title: ROCO MINIMALIST Aluminum Slim Wallet RFID BLOCKING Money Clip - No.2
product_meta.description:
Have you ever lost something and felt the uneasiness in the pit of your stomach? Have you ever had something stolen from you with absolutely NO recourse? Have you ever had your identity stolen and your life ruined? Now is the time to protect yourself and your personal information embedded in your financial cards. Invest in the ROCO RFID Blocking Money Clip TODAY! 

What exactly is RFID? RFID is Radio Frequency Identification Denoting technologies that use radio waves to identify people and objects carrying encoded chips. These can be found in credit cards, passports, access cards, or other forms of ID. 

✔Increase your security by investing in the single best solution to blocking RFID waves and the theft of your personal information. 

✔Carry your wealth in style with the sleek and stylish, aluminum encased wallet. Although slim in size, it can carry up to 20 cards and cash! 

✔Quality products through quality contruction has allowed ROCO to provide YOU with a protective wallet that will last you a lifetime. You will never need to buy another wallet again! 

Isn’t it time you take back the control from these thieves and stop walking around in fear that your private, personal information is being stolen? Then click on the Add to Cart button now to choose the single best RFID Blocking Money Clip by ROCO today!
feature_bullets: IMPROVED VERSION ✔ With wider band to provide easy use of our unique minimal wallet

BLOCK THE THIEVES ✔ Thieves are becoming increasingly smarter in stealing personal information. With the ROCO MINIMALIST RFID Blocking Money Clip, keep your personal information contained within your credit cards safe!

SUPREME QUALITY ✔ ROCO is committed to designing quality products. It’s for this reason the ROCO MINIMALIST wallet was designed to be ultra slim crafted with a high grade aluminum. Crafted with a patented, flexible silicone band, the ROCO MINIMALIST RFID Blocking Money Clip is highly flexible, yet won't lose its strength & stability.

ULTRA SLIM ✔ ROCO's engineers desired to create a minimalist wallet which would be perfect for business cards, credit cards, driver’s license, and so much more! It’s elegant, compact design allows for front pocket or rear pocket storage. Even with its slim design, the ROCO MINIMALIST RFID Blocking Money Clip can hold up to 20 cards.

PREMIER CRAFTSMANSHIP ✔ ROCO pursued an obsessive attention to detail & our wallets are made from top industry standard aluminium metal. Each individual piece is uniquely crafted for superior strength and stability. You’ll love carrying your cards in the ROCO MINIMALIST RFID Blocking Money Clip!
